verses.roman:
sthūṇā-sthūlā varṣa-dhārā
muñcatsv abhreṣv abhīkṣṇaśaḥ
jalaughaiḥ plāvyamānā bhūr
nādṛśyata natonnatam

synonyms: sthūṇā—like columns; sthūlāḥ—massive; varsa-dhārāḥ—downpours of rain; muñcatsu—releasing; abhreṣu—the clouds; abhīkṣṇaśaḥ—incessantly; jala-oghaiḥ—by the flood of water; plāvyamānā—being submerged; bhūḥ—the earth; na adṛśyata—could not be seen; nataunnatam—low or high.
translation: As the clouds released torrents of rain as thick as massive columns, the earth was submerged in the flood, and high ground could no longer be distinguished from low.
